forumNotes.author: Armar
forumNotes.content:
I want to boot an old pc without a HD from usb.  
The bios doesn't support booting from usb.  

So I got PLoP to boot and xpud(.org) as a distro.  
It's working fine but I have to select where I want to boot from and want it to automatically go to usb.  
From what I saw in the readme it seems to be impossible to edit the config of plpbt.iso.  
Is there a way to edit it, use a different file or a different method to achieve this?

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
There is the configuration utility, you will need to re.create the iso or edit it, of course:  
[http://www.plop.at/e...r.html#plpcfgbt](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html#plpcfgbt "External link")  

> Configure hidden boot and boot the usb device  
> plpcfgbt stm=hidden cnt=on cntval=1 dbt=usb plpbt.bin

Wonko
